title: doccano init fails with importerror
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: ubuntu 20.04 lts
*   Python Version Used: 3.8
*   When you install doccano:
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): pip install doccano (which used version == 1.4.1)

the following error occurs after running `doccano init`
```
azureuser@doccano-server:~$ doccano init
Setup Database.
Filepond app init: Creating temporary file upload directory </home/azureuser/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/backend/filepond-temp-uploads>
Filepond app init: Creating file store directory </home/azureuser/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/backend/media>...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/azureuser/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/backend/manage.py", line 15, in <module>
    execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
  File "/home/azureuser/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 419, in execute_from_command_line
    utility.execute()
  File "/home/azureuser/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 413, in execute
    self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)

    self.execute(*args, **cmd_options)
```

I believe this is because of breaking changes in dj-rest-auth package. I downgraded that from 2.1.8 -> 2.1.5 and the issue went away.
